alert.note: Alert for Berrien (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 06 at 9:44AM EST until March 10 at 1:00AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... North Branch Elkhart River at Cosperville affecting Noble County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...Michigan... Saint Joseph River Michigan at South Bend affecting St. Joseph, Elkhart and Berrien Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saint Joseph River Michigan at South Bend. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, The river reaches flood stage with the lowest residential areas beginning to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM EST Monday the stage was 5.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 5.7 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
